title: Lower Prices, Better Weather, Fewer Tourists And More Attractions
text: New York is a dream city for travelers. It has some of the most famous tourist spots like the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge and Central Park. Historic viewpoints like the Empire State and some amazing new viewpoints like Summit One Vanderbilt. As if that wasn’t enough, it has world-class museums like the Met, the American Museum of Natural History, and some of the best plays on Broadway. But what is the best season to visit New York? The answer depends on your interests and travel tastes. What are you looking for? low prices? Nice weather? Attractions without crowds of tourists? Best festival? We break every single one. we recommend you If you’re looking for low prices on flights, hotels, and Broadway shows, the best time to find them is late January, all of February, early March, and September. Read Also: The Ukraine-Russia crisis continues. How did we get here, and what is happening? - National | Globalnews.ca However, you should keep in mind that prices drop in winter as the cold is at its peak and there is usually snowfall which makes transit and outdoor activities difficult. Another way to save is to go to free attractions. Visit the Brooklyn Bridge, Central Park, The Vessel, take the Staten Island Ferry, visit Times Square, Little Island or visit the 9/11 Memorial. If you don’t want sub-zero cold or oppressive heat, we recommend visiting in spring and autumn. From late March to early May, you can enjoy warm weather that is suitable for enjoying the city on foot and visiting the outdoor scenery. Traveling in late September, October or November is perfect for those who prefer mild weather with a slight chill in the morning and at night. Just keep in mind that cloudy days may affect your sightseeing trip. If you can’t stand the heat, avoid visiting in June, July and August as it can be humid. There is more chance of snowfall in February. If you want to enjoy New York City without the crowds, it’s best to go during the non-holiday season. If the kids are in school and there are no holidays in the United States, this is a good time to go. Typically, low season in New York occurs in February, early March, April, and early May. September and October also. Avoid the months of June, July, August and December as holidays are in abundance during this time. Christmas is the quintessential festive season in New York. So in December you will find Christmas decorations, festivals, concerts and more markets. Plus, the iconic New Year’s Eve reception in Times Square. However, the price of flights and hotels can double. If you’re going to see the city’s classic attractions, you can visit them in any season.
